snippet: Tom Wheeler, President Obama’s choice to lead the agency, said its support of competition was especially important because of Americans’ dependence on communications networks.
abstract: Pres Obama's nominee to head Federal Communications Commission, Tom Wheeler, tells Senate committee that his top priorities would be consumer protection, increasing competition and and providing sufficient predictability so companies know what rulings to expect; stresses importance of competition as Americans are increasingly dependent on communications networks in education, public safety and consumer services.
lead_paragraph: Tom Wheeler, President Obama’s choice to lead the agency, said its support of competition was especially important because of Americans’ dependence on communications networks.

headline.main: F.C.C. Nominee Favors Competition Over Regulation
headline.print_headline: F.C.C. Nominee Favors Competition Over Regulation

keywords.value: Senate Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation
keywords.name: organizations
